title: COVID-19 Booster Shot Myths Busted! Tatler Debunks Misconceptions
author: Jove Moya
description: Should you get a booster shot against the deadly COVID-19? We definitely think so and here's why:
cleaned_text: The cases of COVID-19 infections in the Philippines have dipped since local government units started to roll out the vaccines necessary to prevent the spread of the deadly virus. Few months after getting their vaccine jabs, Filipinos are asked to return once more for boosters Time and time again, health experts have been keen on reminding civilians to keep themselves protected against COVID-19. One of the best things to do is get jabs of vaccines that help defend bodies against the deadly and contagious disease. Months after the [initial vaccination roll out](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/wellness/covid-19-vaccination-in-the-ph-timeline-status-and-more), local government units (LGUs) have announced that they are now giving away booster shots for citizens who wish to get an extra layer of protection against COVID-19. See also: [PH COVID-19 Vaccination Simplified: Timeline, Status, And More](https://www.tatlerasia.com/power-purpose/ideas-education/covid-booster-shots-explained?preview=1) Tatler has debunked some booster myths below: 1. You must pay for the vaccine The vaccine is free for everyone in the Philippines. In [November](https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2021/12/02/2145269/philippines-offer-booster-shots-all-adults-beginning-dec-3), the government has already started giving boosters to medical workers, senior citizens, and people with weakened immune systems.
